candidate_text: It has everything you want from a superhero movie: Action, humor, heart, and even some social commentary.
In theaters now!
This movie also explores her backstory, revealing how she became the powerful being known as Captain Marvel.
Captain Marvel is set to be released on March 8, 2019.
The movie also stars Samuel L. Jackson, Ben Mendelsohn, Brie Larson, and Jude Law.
It was recently reported that Captain Marvel will be getting a sequel, with Megan McDonnell set to write the script and Brie Larson reprising her role as Carol Danvers/Captain Marvel.
Captain Marvel will be the 21st film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) and is expected to be a huge success at the box office.
Captain Marvel is set to release on March 8th, 2019, and tickets are already available for purchase in select theaters.
Captain Marvel will be released on March 8, 2019.
The film has received mixed reviews from critics but is expected to perform well at the box office.
Captain Marvel has received widespread critical acclaim for its action sequences, visuals, and performances, particularly from Larson.
The upcoming superhero film is directed by Anna Boden and Ryan Fleck, and it will be released on March 8, 2019.
Captain Marvel opens in theaters on March 8, 2019.

Here are some of the first reactions from critics who saw the film at an early preview screening:
"Captain Marvel is an electrifying blast of sci-fi action and adventure.
Brie Larson rules the screen, and her chemistry with Sam Jackson is undeniable.
Brie Larson owns the role, bringing warmth, wit, and a sense of humor to the Marvel Cinematic Universe.
I loved every minute of it!"
Brie Larson brings a welcome sense of humor and humanity to the role, and the movie's '90s setting is a nice change of pace for the MCU."
It’s a fun, funny, and occasionally fabulous ride that never forgets its emotional core.
It’s a movie that never stops moving, with plenty of twists and turns to keep you guessing until the very end.
And yet, it still finds time for humor, heart, and even a little bit of social commentary."
And yet, it still finds time for humor, heart, and even a little bit of nostalgia."
Brie Larson brings so much depth and nuance to Carol Danvers, it’s like we’re seeing a character reborn."
